parts.text:
[Statement 1]: There are no studies that have evaluated the effects of planting vegetation as a pollution buffer next to roads on shrubland ecosystems.
[Statement 2]: No studies were found that evaluated the effects on shrublands of planting vegetation to act as a buffer to exclude pollution.
[Statement 3]: No studies were found that evaluated the effects on shrublands of creating buffer zones beside roads and other transportation corridors.
[Statement 4]: There is currently no scientific evidence available to determine whether planting vegetation buffers next to roads is effective on shrubland ecosystems.
[Statement 5]: There is currently no scientific evidence available to determine whether planting vegetation buffers next to roads has any harmful impacts on shrubland ecosystems.

key: fireworks_kimi-k2-0905__How does planting vegetation as a pollution buffer next to roads affect shrubland ecosystems?
